Key Match Events: Jason Holder sent back four batsmen for seven runs to dismiss top-ranked England for a paltry 103 in the first of five ODIs at Kensington Oval in Barbados.
Brandon King hit a confident half-century to push West Indies to a satisfying nine-wicket win.
Holder took 3.4-18-7-4, while Cottrell’s analysis read 4-16-30-2, and Hosein claimed 1/16.
England’s top scorer Chris Jordan (28) and Adil Rashid (22) were dismissed by Holder.
West Indies’ opening partnership of Brandon King and Shai Hope ensured they chased the target successfully.
Adil Rashid’s figures of 4-2 in the previous match against West Indies were far inferior to his current performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Kieron Pollard emphasized the importance of consistency and repeated performance in the upcoming matches.
Eoin Morgan mentioned the challenge of balancing risk and reward in the subsequent games.
Post-Match Reflections: Kieron Pollard praised his team's clinical display and noted the batsmen’s adjustment to the wicket conditions.
Eoin Morgan focused on improving their cricket for the next match and the upcoming weekend.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The convincing victory was no one-man show, with contributions from multiple West Indian players.
England had no answers to West Indies' bowling strategy, with only four batsmen reaching double figures.
